embeds.description:
# AdvancedServerList FAQ

This channel lists frequently asked questions about the plugin.
Make sure to check this first before asking any questions in <#1227443810301247571>.

## Does the plugin support Legacy Colors (`&`/`ยง`)?

No, the plugin only supports MiniMessage tags.
Explanations for why can be found on the [Formatting Wiki Page](https://asl.andre601.ch/profiles/formatting/#why-minimessage).

Should you have troubles properly formatting things can you use the [Online Tool](https://webui.advntr.dev/) provided by the Kyori Adventure devs.

## How can I center the MOTD?

Since [`v5.2.0`](https://codeberg.org/Andre601/AdvancedServerList/releases/tag/v5.2.0) can you center the MOTD by prefixing the lines with `<center>`.
Before this version are you required to manually add spaces to the start of each line.

-# Please note that `<center>` uses hardcoded values for max width of the MOTD, spaces used to center the text and the text itself.
-# It also only supports the Fonts `default`, `alt` and `uniform` through the `<font>` tag.
-# Clients using different GUI scales and/or custom fonts may not see the text centered.

## My Server shows as "outdated" when using `playerCount -> text`

To display a custom text for the Player count is AdvancedServerlist modifying the text that usually displays the Server type and version when a player pings the server with an incompatible Version.
This also means that in order to display this text, AdvancedServerList has to make the version of server and client be considered incompatible, resulting in the Ping icon being crossed out and reporting your client or the server being outdated.

This is an issue that isn't just in AdvancedServerList, but any plugin that modifies the player count text in this way.

## My server shows weirdly on a Server Status page/Are Server status pages supported?

There is no way for AdvancedServerList to know, if the ping came from a player or a server list, unless the server list shares their method of checking a server's availability, in which case I can try implementing a fix, if possible.

## Does AdvancedServerList support migrating from other plugins?

Yes.
AdvancedServerList currently supports migrating from the following plugins:

- [`ServerListPlus`](https://asl.andre601.ch/migration/plugins/serverlistplus/)
- [`MiniMOTD`](https://asl.andre601.ch/migration/plugins/minimotd/)

Click the links above to get to the respective Migration page.
Do note that depending on the plugin, there may be specific requirements or limitations at place.

## Are vanish plugins supported?

AdvancedServerList can support Vanish plugins, excluding vanished players from the `${server playersOnline}` placeholder.

The following Vanish plugins are supported:

fields.name: Paper (Including forks):
fields.value: - Any plugin that adds the `vanished` Metadata to the player

embeds.description:
## The wiki is unavailable!

The wiki is provided using a service called [Codeberg Pages](https://codeberg.page), a service similar to GitHub Pages.
Unfortunately is this service not as stable and robust as GitHub Pages, so downtimes can happen.

I have no control over the service, so if the Wiki is down due to an issue, you'll have to wait for it to come back online.
The Service's status can be tracked on [status.codeberg.org](https://status.codeberg.org) (See `Codeberg Pages` entry).

If you really need the Wiki, can you check the original source in the [`docs/` folder of the plugin](https://codeberg.org/Andre601/AdvancedServerList/src/branch/master/docs)
